transportAdvice: Liverpool has a good public transit network including buses, a local rail network, and a ferry across the Mersey, with most major attractions in the city centre reachable on foot or by bus. Taxis are widely available, and the compact waterfront and city centre areas are very walkable for tourists.

weather.description: Cold and frequently wet with short daylight hours, typical of a northern English winter.
Similar to January, cold and damp with occasional frost and grey skies.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures but rain remains common.
Noticeably brighter with longer days, though showers are still frequent.
Pleasant spring weather with more sunshine and mild temperatures.
Warm and generally pleasant, though overcast days and showers are still possible.
The warmest month of the year with long evenings and a mix of sun and cloud.
Warm summer conditions continue, with occasional rain but plenty of daylight.
Early autumn brings cooler evenings but still comfortable daytime temperatures.
Noticeably cooler and wetter as autumn sets in, with shorter days.
Cold and frequently rainy with limited sunshine, typical late autumn conditions.
Cold and wet with the shortest days of the year, though festive atmosphere in the city centre.
